Obelisk-0.0.1: An simple object oriented language, with a strongly typed form of duck-typing.ContentsIndex
Language.Obelisk.AST
Description
Abstract syntax tree for Obelisk
Synopsis
newtype Obelisk v m = Obelisk [Stmt v m]
data Stmt v m
= Def m [v] (Returner v m)
| If m (Exp v m) (Returner v m) (Returner v m)
| SetLocal m v (Exp v m)
| SetGlobal m v (Exp v m)
| StmtExp m (Exp v m)
data Returner v m = Returner m (Obelisk v m) (Exp v m)
data Exp v m
= Apply m (Exp v m) [Exp v m]
| Infix m (Exp v m) (Exp v m)
| OVar m v
| OInt m Integer
| OBool m Bool
Documentation
newtype Obelisk v m
The obelisk AST is parametrized over a variable type v, and a metadata type m
Constructors
Obelisk [Stmt v m]
data Stmt v m
Statements in obelisk
Constructors
Def m [v] (Returner v m)Define a function
If m (Exp v m) (Returner v m) (Returner v m)If the expression is true, then evaluate the first piece of code, else the second
SetLocal m v (Exp v m)Set the local variable v equal to the result of the expression
SetGlobal m v (Exp v m)Set the global variable v equal to the result of the expression
StmtExp m (Exp v m)Evaluate an expression
data Returner v m
If a piece of code is to return a value, the last item must be an expression
Constructors
Returner m (Obelisk v m) (Exp v m)
data Exp v m
Expressions in obelisk
Constructors
Apply m (Exp v m) [Exp v m]Function application
Infix m (Exp v m) (Exp v m)Infix application
OVar m vA variable
OInt m IntegerAn integer
OBool m BoolA literal boolean
